thread.title: Gaming and Leisure Properties, Inc. Schedules First Earnings Release and Conference Call

author: cnbc.com
title: Gaming and Leisure Properties, Inc. Schedules First Earnings Release and Conference Call
text:
WYOMISSING, Pa., Gaming and Leisure Properties, Inc. (NASDAQ:GLPI) today announced that the Company will release its 2018 first quarter financial results at 7:00 a.m. ET on Wednesday, April 25, 2018 and will host a conference call at 9:00 a.m. ET on Wednesday, April 25, 2018.
During the conference call, Peter M. Carlino, Chairman and Chief Executive Officer, and William J. Clifford, Chief Financial Officer, will review the quarter’s results and performance, discuss recent events and conduct a question-and-answer period.
Webcast
The conference call will be available in the Investor Relations section of the Company’s website at www.glpropinc.com . To listen to a live broadcast, go to the site at least 15 minutes prior to the scheduled start time in order to register, download and install any necessary audio software. A replay of the call will also be available for 90 days on the Company’s website.
To Participate in the Telephone Conference Call:
Dial in at least five minutes prior to start time.
Domestic: 1-877-407-0784
International: 1-201-689-8560
Conference Call Playback :
Domestic: 1-844-512-2921
International: 1-412-317-6671
Passcode: 13678592
The playback can be accessed through May 2, 2018.
About Gaming and Leisure Properties
GLPI is engaged in the business of acquiring, financing, and owning real estate property to be leased to gaming operators in triple-net lease arrangements, pursuant to which the tenant is responsible for all facility maintenance, insurance required in connection with the leased properties and the business conducted on the leased properties, taxes levied on or with respect to the leased properties and all utilities and other services necessary or appropriate for the leased properties and the business conducted on the leased properties. GLPI elected to be taxed as a real estate investment trust (“REIT”) for United States federal income tax purposes commencing with the 2014 taxable year.
